i need to go in a few minutes, but i think the problem is in your .gnome2 directory. sometimes gnome gets a little confused, leaving it in an awkward state. that would explain why you get a background and cursor, but no toolbars. if you move that directory temporarily, you force gnome to reinitialise it, hopefully fixing your problem. alternatively, making a new account would be a quick way to verify that that is where the problem lies. good luck!
